qas.question: How many departments does the Punjab administration have?

answers.text: a Provincial Minister (Politician) and a Provincial Secretary

qas.question: Who do the Provincial Ministers report to?
Who do the Provincial Secretaries report to?
What rank is the Chief Secretary?
What is the civil servant designation for the Chief Minister?
Who does the Chief Minister report to?
What is the number of attached departments that report to secretaries?
What is the rank of a Provincial Minister?
What does the Chief Minister send to the Chief Secretary?

context: There are <a0_0><b7_0>48<b7_0/><a0_0/> departments in Punjab government. Each Department is headed by <a1_0>a Provincial Minister (Politician) and a Provincial Secretary<a1_0/> (A civil servant of usually BPS-20 or <b8_0>BPS-21<b8_0/>). All Ministers report to <a2_0>the Chief Minister<a2_0/>, who is the Chief Executive. All Secretaries report to <a3_0>the Chief Secretary of Punjab<a3_0/>, who is <a4_0>usually a <b5_0>BPS-22<b5_0/> Civil Servant<a4_0/>. <b6_0>The Chief Secretary<b6_0/> in turn <b9_0>reports<b9_0/> to the Chief Minister. In addition to these departments, there are several Autonomous Bodies and Attached Departments that report directly to either the Secretaries or the Chief Secretary.
